segment.source: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.
segment.target: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.

segment.source: You can get this token in the Dev Center dashboard on the Maps page in the Services section.
segment.target: You can get this token in the Dev Center dashboard on the Maps page in the Services section.

segment.source: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.
segment.target: To use map services in apps for Windows Phone 8.1 and earlier, you need a map service application ID and a token to include in your app's code.

segment.source: You can get this token in the Dev Center dashboard on the Maps page in the Services section.
segment.target: You can get this token in the Dev Center dashboard on the Maps page in the Services section.

segment.source: Note To use map services in apps targeting other operating systems, visit the Bing Maps Dev Center.
segment.target: Note To use map services in apps targeting other operating systems, visit the Bing Maps Dev Center.

segment.source: See Request a maps authentication key for more info.
segment.target: See Request a maps authentication key for more info.

segment.source: Once you've reserved your app's name, look for the Services section in the left navigation menu and expand it to show the Maps page.
segment.target: Once you've reserved your app's name, look for the Services section in the left navigation menu and expand it to show the Maps page.

segment.source: When you click Get token, the ApplicationID and AuthenticationToken will be generated and will appear on this page.
segment.target: When you click Get token, the ApplicationID and AuthenticationToken will be generated and will appear on this page.

segment.source: Note You don’t have to finish submitting your app at this time.
segment.target: Note You don’t have to finish submitting your app at this time.

segment.source: After you request a token and ID, this info will be saved on this page.
segment.target: After you request a token and ID, this info will be saved on this page.

segment.source: You can return to this page at any time to access this info.
segment.target: You can return to this page at any time to access this info.

segment.source: You'll also need to make sure to add the ApplicationID and AuthenticationToken to your code before you package and submit your app.
segment.target: You'll also need to make sure to add the ApplicationID and AuthenticationToken to your code before you package and submit your app.

segment.source: For more info, see How to add a Map control to a page (Windows Phone 8.1).
segment.target: For more info, see How to add a Map control to a page (Windows Phone 8.1).
